channel.title: The Daily Pratchett
channel.description: A quote from Sir Terry Pratchett every day.

item.title: 14-Nov-16
item.description:
"However, you do *need* rules. Driving on the left (or the right or, in parts of Europe, on the left and the right as the mood takes you) is a rule which works, since following it means you're more likely to reach your intended rather than your final destination."

- Terry Pratchett, alt.fan.pratchett

item.title: 13-Nov-16
item.description:
"Not only did I wipe Lemmings from my hard disc, I overwrote it so's I couldn't get it back."

- Terry Pratchett, alt.fan.pratchett

item.title: 12-Nov-16
item.description:
"A lie can run round the world before the truth has got its boots on."

- Terry Pratchett, The Truth

item.title: 11-Nov-16
item.description:
"A marriage is always made up of two people who are prepared to swear that only the other one snores."

- Terry Pratchett, The Fifth Elephant

item.title: 10-Nov-16
item.description:
"The door was still ajar, but there was a tentative tap on it which said, in a kind of metaphorical morse code, that the tapper could see very well that Carrot was in his room with a scantily clad woman and was trying to knock without actually being heard."

- Terry Pratchett, Men at Arms
